author: sbpabon
title: GIMBALABS TREASURY FOR TUTORS
description: Members of Gimbalabs are offering mentoring services to new students without financial recognition for their hours of work.

f6_assessments.q0:
“There are many resources for learning about Cardano and how to become a Plutus developer”, is a phrase I wish I could say, but the truth is we have a long way to go until that becomes a reality. Building a strong foundation for developer training is especially important because of Cardano’s eUTxo model and Haskell-based programming make it pretty unique in the blockchain world and daunting for most developers who don't want to necessarily leave their comfort zone. Honestly even among the few developers that we have, I only know of one who doesn’t find Plutus difficult. So it’s very important that the developers that are willing to sacrifice their time and put their skills at work teaching other developers are acknowledged and properly compensated.

This proposal is addressing the Developer Ecosystem challenge head-on by looking to offer developers support through education.

I haven't been to any of the Gimbalabs sessions personally, but it seems like people who have are very satisfied. I also see that they're developing new techniques and generating high-quality educational content for Cardano-related topics, such as Plutus, regularly. That’s why I think that this proposal, looking to fund tutor hours for the Gimbalabs educators, would be a very good investment for the Cardano treasury.

Make no mistake by providing tutoring, they are sacrificing, at least financially, by volunteering their time. Plutus developers are very in demand at the moment, and the hourly rates are multiple times higher than the one quoted for tutoring in this proposal.

On top of this, the proposal itself is very well written and makes a very good case for why it fits so well in the Developer Ecosystem challenge.

If we want Cardano to succeed in gaining market share it’s crucial that we build a strong support network for developers, providing them with guidance and practical advice on how they can succeed working on our blockchain.

I'm writing this assessment based on my experience as part of the Catalyst community since February 2021 and my engagement with the Cardano development communities since March 2021. I also have experience working directly with  Cardano developers since July 2021.
f6_assessments.q1:
The implementation plan presented makes a lot of sense in the context of this educational project. The team plans to offer 2-hour tutoring sessions, 6 times per week for three months.
The detailed budget is also very easy to follow by simply multiplying the resulting 96 hours per month by an hourly rate of $30 for 3 months.

One sidetone here, given that the Catalyst funding schedule has now moved to 4 months per fund instead of 3, I wonder if having planned for 3 months is an oversight on behalf of the team or if they plan to offer the tutoring sessions for 3 months only.

As mentioned before the $30/hour rate is extremely reasonable given the value of the service provided and I view it more as a symbolic rate, given the current industry rates for Plutus developers.

Even though no exact names are provided in the proposal, as the Gimbalabs team plans to work with a bounty system for their tutoring sessions, the core Gimbalabs team have proven to be very solid over the past, at least a year and a half, and I have no doubt that the project as a whole will be successfully implemented.

Fund 9 saw the introduction of two new workload questions, one for previously funded proposals and one for proposals/projects submitted in Fund 9. In the case of this proposal, both are answered “Yes”.  But, no details are provided in the main feasibility section as requested when submitting the proposal. I won't deduct any points from my rating for this, as the questions are new to Fund 9, but I do recommend that the team include these details on future submissions.
f6_assessments.q2:
The accountability plan and the bounty system for tutors presented by the Gimbalabs team make a lot of sense in the context of this proposal and will offer the community the data it needs to track the implementation of this proposal.

The KPIs described in the proposal and the definitions of success also revolve around the bounty system and the number of tutoring sessions provided - very simple and clear, in line with the proposal as a whole.

Given Gimbalabs very visible presence in the community, the deliverables and results of this proposal will most likely make themselves known without the need for an actual auditinf process.

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea is brilliant. The problem described in the proposal addresses the challenge. Creating a treasury funded by catalyst to cover the tutors’ working hours of Gimbalabs (a non-profit organization) is not of benefit to only the tutors and students but to cardano ecosystem as a whole. However, the proposal appears to be more of a non-app innovation rather than building an app.  The scalability potential of the proposal is very high because I believe it’s flexibility and can be made to fit into other challenges in the long run. The proposer has indicated that the sustainability of the project would be that the team would have return in later project catalyst funds to secure funds for its operation.
The proposal I must say is impactful.
f6_assessments.q1: With the information provided about the team’s relevant experience and considering the relevant links and video attachment I am confident that the team is well equipped to implement the project. There is clarity in the information and details of the team, however it would have been best to outline some members from the organization that will be active in executing the project. The budget is well outlined. I appreciate the fact that the budget cost has been broken down as monthly cost for three (3) months. The budget is also reasonable to achieve the set goals. It’s a good effort that the proposer has foreseen the possible risks/challenges that may arise during the implementation of the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap presented is detailed with clear milestones and time horizon. The KPIs stated are geared towards measuring the number of tutoring hours and budget spent per month, they are however not exhaustive. It would have been good if the proposer had measured the number of student developers to be realized at the end of the project implementation. For the problem described, there is clarity and also the solution. The proposed solution of the proposer in my view is effective to address the problem identified if funded.
The proposer has indicated that they would keep track of the tutoring hours through a system of bounties, however no inclusion has been provided as to how the project’s progress would be shared to the general cardano or catalyst communication. I foresee that it would make it difficult for community to track the progress of the project and hence the auditability can be a challenge.
Auditability is not 100% guaranteed due to the issues identified above.

f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap is very well designed, there are deliverables/milestones that make it easier to audit the proposal including the fact that Gimbalabs plans to keep track of the hours of tutoring provided by their tutors in fulfilling their service, through a bonus system, in this case it is easier to know who has been paid and why based on the number of hours of tutoring projected in the Gimbalabs calendar available on their site. f6_assessments.q0: Gimbalabs is a project that focuses on education in the Cardano community. They have another proposal that is focused on bringing education to students interested in developing or building on Cardano. This proposal is to help fund the tutors taht will be helping members of their team. It will be a treasury that helps sustain their project as a non-profit organization. This proposal can help improve the Cardano ecosystem by bringing greater education to the young community members. The project as of now will have a local effect as they are focused on students at Oxford University. However, I would like to see the project create tutorials and have tutors that are broadcasted or utilized online. This can lead to having a global impact and will have the opportunity to provide education to more community members and developers around the world. For these reasons, I give this section 4 out of 5 stars. There could also be more information included on how this proposal will specifically benefit the Challenge setting of "Developer Ecosystem." How will this provide utility to the developers in the Cardano ecosystem?
f6_assessments.q1: The team at Gimbalabs has a lot of experience in the Cardano ecosystem. There is a link provided in the proposal that takes you to their website. On their website, it includes information on all of the team members and their experience. It also highlights their accomplishments which helps determine the potential likelihood of this proposal being implemented successfully. In the roadmap provided, there are specific details that suggest when the project plans to complete certain features of this proposed idea. They provide exactly what will be happening every month for 3 months until completion. These specific details and timeframes are important because it allows for the team at Gimbalabs to be held accountable for their work. There is also a detailed budget breakdown that is specific and helps the reader of the proposal to visualize where the requested funds would be allocated if funded. There are specific details and will also hold the team accountable to ensuring that the rewards would be utilized properly. They have taken into consideration potential setbacks and have plans to address those if necessary. One of these methods will be through tracking their progress daily and monitoring the tutors progress. For these reasons, I give this section 5 stars as it is extremely specific and gives a plan that supports their proposed idea to bring more education to the Cardano blockchain.
f6_assessments.q2: I was impressed with the amount of information included in this proposal. However, it is important to note that it is not excessive. The information is concise and straight to the point, while including the important details. There is specific information included in this proposal that supports the auditability of the potential success of this proposed idea. The specific dates and timeframes in the roadmap and budget breakdown are extremely important because it allows for the principle of accountability to play a part. This also applies to the details provided on the team members and their experience. The community, students, and supporters will be able to hold the team accountable and can ensure that things will be implemented in a timely manner. It is important to note that the team should be aware of the principle of transparency. The team should be open with their future students and help keep them up to date with the details as this proposal becomes a reality. There should also be a focus on accountability. This was mentioned before, and should be taken seriously by the team. The specific details provided will allow for accountability to be specific and effective. These metrics of accountability and transparency will help audit the potential success of this proposal. If these things can all be implemented successfully and the community can trust that this project will function as stated. This will become a successful proposal. For these reasons, I give this section of the proposal 4 out of 5 stars. This is because I believe that the proposal could include more information on how they will grow interest from community members and how they will inform the future tutors or students of this project on current updates.

With a tested and efficient PBL system, as well as their prolific tutors from the cardano developer communities, they have strengthened the standard of developers they produce to benefit cardano. Gimbalabs has shown an immense proof of work and the successes it has choked indirectly through its student innovations, examples; jpg.store, rarity, all NFT driven initiatives that benefits the Cardano ecosystem. Aside from that, the proposal also includes information on the specific activities and a concise plan on how to spend the funding. I however commend the organizers for including that they will return any unused money back into the community. This strengthens their transparency level even more as well as a commitment to the  provisions made possible through the project catalyst. The milestones in the proposal break down its training into three months and the goal to provide learners with hands-on experiences in the blockchain/tech industry.
